alert.note: Alert for Brown (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 11:06AM CDT until April 13 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County. Minnesota River At Morton affecting Renville and Redwood Counties. South Fork Crow River below Mayer affecting Carver County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota and Wisconsin... Cottonwood River Above Springfield affecting Brown County. Chippewa River at Durand affecting Buffalo, Dunn and Pepin Counties. Chippewa River at Eau Claire affecting Eau Claire County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt upstream snowpack and increase river flows for the next few days. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River at New Ulm. * WHEN...Until late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flood waters begin to impact low lying areas...and some roads along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 AM CDT Tuesday, the stage was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 11.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.0 feet on 03/07/1994. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
